content.question: In his design for the Pazzi Chapel, Filippo Brunelleschi included Greco-Roman architectural elements mainly because he was interested in

choices.label: including niches for classical statuary that had been repurposed from the Temple of Minerva at Veii
employing classical techniques to allow for building on a larger scale, in imitation of the Colosseum (Flavian Amphitheater)
adapting the principles of harmony and balance that he saw reflected in ancient Roman structures to fit Renaissance ideas
pursuing classical methods of building efficiently because the religious order had taken a vow of poverty

content.answer: adapting the principles of harmony and balance that he saw reflected in ancient Roman structures to fit Renaissance ideas
